Read more Key notes LinkedIn revealed impressive growth in its premium subscription service, generating a whopping $1.7 billion in revenue for 2023. Now wonder why X moved into a similar business. For those who don’t know. This marks the first time that Microsoft has disclosed figures for this specific business segment, as revealed by Reuters. The surge is attributed to a notable rise in users adopting LinkedIn’s new AI-powered features designed to empower job seekers. What does it do though? Well, these tools offer functionalities like analyzing job postings for fit based on resumes, suggesting profile improvements for better visibility to recruiters, and even generating messages to initiate contact.
